patchNotes.title: Talent rework

texts.text: If Xul writes 'I Sense... Death' he will start seeing ghosts of every unit that have died within the last 8 seconds on a 10 radius.
Xul basic attack's with the Dagger deal 25% bonus damage over 3 seconds.

general.developerCommentary: This is just roleplay to reflect his connection with death and Poison Dagger

texts.text: Additional functionality: Hitting enemy units reduce the cooldown by 0.2 seconds, up to 12 seconds. This bonus is increased to 1 second on enemy heroes.

general.developerCommentary: The objective here is to make <modified, abilities, basic, 1> less frustating to use if you don't go for melee talents.

texts.text: Additionarl functionality: Quest: Spawn 80 <vanilla, abilities, trait, 0>.Reward: While fixating on an enemy, <vanilla, abilities, trait, 0> gain 25% Movement and Attack Speed.

general.developerCommentary: I am popping talents to deal with summoners on different characters and for this reason i don't want to fear them but rather go further on that concept.

patchNotes.developerCommentary: Xul is currently a little forgotten atleast on meta play specially since the constant nerfs to his priority on double soaking and the addition of new stronger heroes to the same job. My objective here is to bring more variety on the build focusing on his Diablo 2 scheme and reducing the verticalization of his talents.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 4, 0> renamed to <modified, talents, 4, 0>

texts.text: Changed functionality: Instead of summoning multiple <modified, abilities, trait, 0> in an area, Xul now accumulates them into a single, more powerful unit. For each accumulated Skeleton, the unit's stats increase by 50% of the base Skeleton's stats also increasing it's duration by 1 and stacking on-hit effects.
subtexts: The stats will be health, damage, explosion damage and size
The on-hit effects means that if three <modified, abilities, trait, 0> stacked his hit will count as if it hit three times the same target.
This will be prioritized before the <modified, abilities, trait, 0> limit so if you summon a 4th skeleton it will first check that talent before destroying a skeleton
The check area will be 6.5 same as <vanilla, talents, 10, 1, blaze>

Better details: Every time a Skeleton would be born it will first check if there's another skeletal warrior on the area if there is a skeleton alive instead of being summoned he will buff the alive skeletal
Example: If Xul kills a minion wave instead of having 7 skeletons(that will be subsequentially killing each of other based on the limit of 3) he will summon 1 big skeleton with 200% more status

changes.developerCommentary: In essence it's a way to bypass the <modified, abilities, trait, 0> summon limit while not making hordes of skeletons

During this time, the target can only see what's within their own reduced vision radius.

If this talent comes to be overpowered i would bring something like <vanilla, talents, 20, 2, kharazim> with the reduced effectiviness of those talents.

texts.text: Xul creates an area that controls life that lasts 10 seconds. Every allied hero that dies within this area will be reanimated restoring 100% of their maximum health but losing 6.25% of their maximum health every 0.25 seconds while on reanimated state.
subtexts: The reanimation will take effect after every death effect, so it will only revive Uther after his <vanilla, abilities, trait, 0, uther> expires and will activate his passive again after his reanimated form dies.
Area of effect will be 7.0 | <vanilla, abilities, heroic, 1, blaze> is 6.5
Their respawn timers will be active while they are reanimated
Their soul will only be available after they reanimation ends. This is a interaction with <modified, abilities, heroic, 0, auriel> and <modified, talents, 13, 1, guldan>
They will only be reanimated if they die on the area and will be reanimated on the exact same position
